bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

div1.p: Isaac Van Bibber adr. Matilda; free black girl
Action of trespass with force & arms damage $5000 July Term of the Circuit Court for St. Charles County

And the said Isaac the defendant by ? attorney comes and defends the charges of the ? & injury ?? & says ? is not quietly
?? upon the country.
And the plaintiff also M McGirk atto for plaintiff

And the said defendant furthermore pleads that on the day & at the place mentioned on the plaintiffs declaration and before that t ? on the nineteenth day of eighteen hund red & nine she the said plaintiff was the slave & property of him the defendant & ? ? slave & property & that on the said last mentioned day he parished the said Matilda of one William Christy whose property she then was & took received from said Christiy a bill of sale in the words ? following ? For & in ??? of the sum of two hundred dollars To me in hand paid the ? whereof I do hereby acknow ledge, have granted ? ? said & ? & by these ? do ? ? self &?? Isaac Van Bibber a negro girl named Matilda I do hereby warrant &defend ? to the said Van Bibber ?? & ? against me & my heirs & against all & every other person or persons ?? claim ?? on to claime the ?, in wit help whereof I Have > my hand the 19th day of June 1809 signed W. Christy. Test. ? B, ??? "By nature of which said > of plaintiff as his slave & property from said Christy ? which ? read to ? ? when he prays judgement of the plaintiffs actions ought not to be borne.
